titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Development Company records 2000.045
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:33 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection consists of 27 annual reports of the Brooklyn Development Company and one annual report of the the Greater New York Development Company. The records span the period 1901 to 1924 and measure 0.2 linear feet. The Brooklyn Development Company was formed in 1899 and comprised 16 Brooklyn-based real estate firms with combined total asset holdings of $300,000 and 726 acres of land.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Development Company records, 2000.045, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
